"Oohhh scraaap.  Rodimus, I haven't seen 'em yet, but I gotta cut this shor=
t.  Got some biiig aft bugs commn' right at me.  I'll reconnect when it's s=
afe.  Night Shift out.  Slaggn' good thing I'm in vehicle mode!"

He puts h=
imself into drive, spins his tires, and quickly finds Rat Trap, who is quic=
k to jump up onto his hood.

"Heey, what's the rush?!"

Night Shift puts do=
wn his driver's side window.

"I was sniffed out when I was in communicatio=
n with Rodimus.  I dunno how the slag we got sniffed but we got sniffed."

=
Rat Trap gets in and now looks into the rear view mirror.

" What the?!  Aw=
 maaaan, I hope you got enough gas ta get us outa here!"

Night Shift accel=
erates quickly to try and get ahead of the horde.

" About a little less th=
an a full tank, lucky for us, I had just fueled up before we left.  But thi=
s ain't gonna last all that long at the rate I'm go'n."

Rat Trap sits back=
.

"Fine time ta realize you're a gass guzzler! Just try ta make back with =
just a little bit of gas left okay?!"

Night Shift speeds up.

" I'm not tr=
y'n ta get  back ta base, I'm tryn' ta out run those bug brains!"

Rat Trap=
 gasps.

" Are you nuts?!  Did you blow a logic circuit somewhere?!  Helloo=
, you aren't exactly a speedster pal!"

Night Shift bounces over fallen bru=
sh and debris.

" I know that!  But we got a comrade ta find and not even t=
hese punks are gonna get in the way of that!"

Rat Trap sighs.

" Grreat, u=
nless by some small miracle that we're saved by a spider, we're in deep sla=
g!"

Night Shift chokes on Rat Trap's statement.

"Ohh no, don't go there..=
  Spiders creep me out."

Rat Trap raises a brow.

"You? Scared of a spider=
?"

Night Shift replies.

"Long story, tell ya when we're outa this mess!"
=

He keeps going, hoping to get away, when without warning, his tire catches=
 a sharp piece of wood and then, with a loud bang, he blows out.

"SCRAAAP!=
  I KNEW THIS WOULD HAPPEN.  HOLD ON, I JUST BLEW A TIRE!"

He swerves out =
of control for a moment while Rat Trap does his best to try and keep the wh=
eel into the skid, hoping to find an opportunity to straighten Night Shift =
out to the point where he can actually control him.

"Ease off the gas, and=
 let yourself slow down."

Night Shift does as told, but not in time to avo=
id a slight hit to his side fender.

"Ow!  Ughhh, what the pit did I hit?"
=

Rat Trap looks out the passenger's side.

"I dunno, but you got a nice den=
t on your side fender buddy."

ive and

While there were light scorch marks, he seemed to be lightly

abdomen, creating a burning wound
